definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: These great embody the women - oriented form of a matriarchal society in sight.
sentences.chinese: 這些體現着婦女爲大爲主的母系社會形態的跡象。

sentences.english: That is due to the matriarchy of its society.
sentences.chinese: 那是因爲他們仍然是母系社會。

sentences.english: As a matrilineal society, they valued women over men, and inheritance was passed from mother to daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他們屬於母系社會，觀念上重女輕男，由女子繼承。

sentences.english: The geisha women live in a strictly matriarchal society.Women dominate.
sentences.chinese: 藝妓生活在一個嚴格的母系社會中，婦女占主導地位。

sentences.english: Bafipo was a matrilineal society and a settled agricultural community.
sentences.chinese: 半坡屬於母系社會，是以農業爲主的定居村落。

sentences.english: In matrilinear societies the real head of the family is the mother's brother.
sentences.chinese: 在母系社會中，家庭裏真正的頭領是媽媽的兄弟。

pinyin: duo1 yuan2 wen2 hua4 zhu3 yi4

definition: slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: (of parents) to bring up children for the purpose of being looked after in old age
